value.original: Defines the columns of a table
The Reference Tab defines the references that are used to validate data
The Table Validation Tab defines tables to validate data
The List Validation Tab defines lists to validate data
The Window Tab defines each window in the system.
Tab definition within a window holds fields
The Tab Tab defines each Tab within a Window. Each Tab contains a descrete selection of fields.
Field definitions in tabs in windows
The Field Tab defines the Fields displayed within a tab. Changes made to the Field Tab become visible after restart due to caching
The Validation Rules Tab defines all dynamic rules used when entering and maintaining columns and fields.
The Message Tab displays error message text and menu messages
The Menu Tab defines the tree structured menu which will be used for the selected Organization.
Menu Translation - May not need to be translated
Menu translations are derived from Window, Process, etc. You only need to translate Summaty level items.
If you want to add an additional User Interface language, select "System Language". Otherwise, the system allows you to just translate elements for printing documents.
Menu Translation - May not need to be translated
Fields are automatically translated, if centrally maintained. You only need to translate not centrally maintained Fields.
The User Tab defines the log in for Users who have access to the system.

Define the role and add the client and organizations the role has access to. You can give users access to this role and modify the access of this role to windows, forms, processes and reports as well as tasks.
The User Assignment Tab displays Users who have been defined for this Role.
The User Roles Tab define the Roles each user may have. The Roles will determine what windows, tasks, processes and workflows that a User has access to.
The Node Tab defines each Node or step in this Workflow.
The Next Nodes Tab defines the order or Nodes or Steps in a Workflow.
The Conversion Rate Tab defines the rates to use when converting a source currency to an accounting or reporting currency.
The Calendar Tab defines each calendar that will be used by an Organization.
The Year Window is used to define each year for the specified calendar.
The Period Tab defines a Period No, Name and Start Date for each Calendar Year. Each period begins on the defined Start Date and ends one day prior to the next period's Start Date.

The Non Business Days Tab defines those days to exclude when calculating the due date for given payment terms. For example, if an invoice terms was Net 10 days and the Invoice Date was 2/17/2000 the due date would be 2/27/2000. If 2/27/2000 was defined as a non busness day then the due date on the Invoice would be 2/28/2000.

The Element Value Tab defines the individual valid values for the Element. The values must conform to the format defined. If the Element is an Account Type then the Account Classification (Asset, Liability etc) and posting controls are also defined

row.value: The Element Value Tab defines the individual valid values for the Element. The values must conform to the format defined. If the Element is an Account Type then the Account Classification (Asset, Liability etc) and posting controls are also defined

value.original: The Unit of Measure Tab defines a non monetary Unit of Measure.
Define standard Unit of Measure Conversion

The Conversion Tab defines the rates for converting a Unit of Measure. The system provides some automatic conversions between units of measures (e.g. minute, hour, day, working day, etc.) if they are not explicitly defined here. Conversions need to be direct (i.e. if you have only a conversion between A-B and B-C, the system cannot convert A-C, you need to define it explicitly).
The Country Tab defines any country in which you do business. Values entered here are referenced in location records for Business Partners.
The Region Tab defines a Region within a Country. This tab is enabled only if the Has Region checkbox is selected for the Country.
When adding a new organization, you must re-login to be able to access the new organization.

The Organization Tab is used to define an Organization. Each Organization has a Key and Name and optionally a Description. When adding a new organization, you must re-login to be able to access the new organization.

The Client Definition Tab defines a unique client. Do not create a new client in this window, but use "Initial Client Setup" to set up the required security and access rules. If you create a new client here, wou will not be able to view it and also the required client infrastructure would not have been set up.

row.value: Клиент это верхний уровень иерархии в системе, каждый клиент будет иметь одну или более организаций (подразделений).\nНе создавайте нового клиента в этом окне, используйте "Создание нового клиента".\n

value.original: The Sequence Tab defines the numeric sequencing to use for documents. These can also include a alpha suffix and / or prefix.
The Workflow Tab defines Workflows in the system.
The Task Tab defines the unique tasks that will be used.
The Currency Tab defines any currency you will transact with or report in.

The Element Tab defines the Name, Description and Format for an Element. Additionaly, a Type of Account or User Defined is selected. Each Account Schema must have an Account Element type. The User Defined Elements are optional.

row.value: The Element Tab defines the Name, Description and Format for an Element. Additionaly, a Type of Account or User Defined is selected. Each Account Schema must have an Account Element type. The User Defined Elements are optional.

value.original: The Location Tab defines the location of an Organization.
Maintain System Client Org and User Preferences
The Project Tab is used to define the Value, Name and Description for each project. It also is defines the tracks the amounts assigned to, commited to and used for this project.
The GL Category Tab defines optional identifiers for a document or journal. Each Category may be used on a document, manual journal or import

row.value: The GL Category Tab defines optional identifiers for a document or journal. Each Category may be used on a document, manual journal or import

value.original: The GL Journal Batch Tab defines the control parameters for a Journal Batch. A Batch can consist of multiple Journals.

row.value: The GL Journal Batch Tab defines the control parameters for a Journal Batch. A Batch can consist of multiple Journals.

value.original: The GL Journal Tab defines the control parameters for a single GL Journal.

row.value: The GL Journal Tab defines the control parameters for a single GL Journal.

value.original: The GL Journal Line Tab defines the individual debit and credit transactions that comprise a journal.

row.value: The GL Journal Line Tab defines the individual debit and credit transactions that comprise a journal.

value.original: The Document Definition Tab defines the processing parameters and controls for the document.
The Approval Tab defines the approval types to be used in documents.
The Client Info Tab defines the detailsfor each client. The accounting rules and high level defaults are defined here.
The Organization Info Tab is used to define an Organization's address, DUNS number and Tax Indentification number
The Attachment tab displays the attributes of an attachment.

The Tax Rate Window defines the different taxes used for each tax category. For example, Sales Tax must be defined for each State in which it applies. If you have multiple taxes, create a summary level tax with the approximate total tax rate and the actual tax rates pointing to the summary level tax as their parent. When entering the order or invoice lines, the tax is estimated, the correct tax is calculated when the document is processed. The tax is always calculated from the line net amount. If one tax has has a the tax basis the line net amount and another tax, you need to adjust the percentage to result in the correct amount.
The Tax Category Tab is used to define and maintain Tax Categories. Each Product is associated with a Tax Category. This facilitates adapting to changes in taxation.
The Warehouse Tab defines each Warehouse that is used to store products.
The Locator Tab defines any Locators for that Warehouse.
The Product Tab defines each product and identifies it for use in price lists and orders.
The Substitute Tab defines products which may be used as a replacement for the selected product.
The Replenishment Tab defines the type of replenishment quantities. This is used for automated ordering.
The Pricing Tab displays the List, Standard and Limit prices for each price list a product is contained in.

The Payment Term Tab defines the different payments terms that you offer to your Business Partners when paying invoices and also those terms which your Vendors offer you for payment of your invoices. On the standard invoice, the Name and the Document Note of the Payment Term is printed.
The Shippers Tab defines any entity who will provide shipping to or shipping from an Organization.
The Order Header Tab defines the parameters of an Order
The Order Line Tab defines the individual line items that comprise an Order.
The Product Category defines unique groupings of products. Product categories can be used in building price lists.
Price lists determine currency of the document as well as tax treatment.
The Price List Tab displays the prices for a product based on the selected price list.
The Invoice Schedule Tab defines the frequency for which batch invoices will be generated for a Business Partner.

The Conversion Rates tab is used to define conversion rates to be used when converting document amounts from one currency to another. Conversion rates can be defined for mulitple rate types. They can also be effective for a defined range of dates.
For changes to become effective, you must re-login

row.value: Каждая организация имеет ссылку на схему учета

value.original: The Accounting Schema Tab defines the controls used for accounting. Each Organization will select an Accounting Schema to use.
The General Ledger Tab defines error and balance handling to use as well as the necessary accounts for posting to General Ledger.

row.value: The General Ledger Tab defines error and balance handling to use as well as the necessary accounts for posting to General Ledger.

value.original: The Marketing Campaign Tab defines the parameters for a Campaign. These include a start and end date as well as the amount of any invoices that have been processed which reference this campaign.
The Marketing Channel Tab defines the different methods or processes through which customers are obtained.
The Element Tab defines each system level element.
The Period Control Tab displays the status of a Period (Never Opened, Opened, Closed).
The Sales Region Tab defines the different regions where you do business. Sales Regions can be used when generating reports or calculating commissions.
The Account Combination Tab defines and displays valid account combination. An Alias can be defined to facilitate document entry.
The GL Budget Tab defines a General Ledger Budget

row.value: The GL Budget Tab defines a General Ledger Budget

value.original: The GL Budgets are used to define the anticipated costs of doing business. They are used in reporting as a comparison to actual amounts.

row.value: The GL Budgets are used to define the anticipated costs of doing business. They are used in reporting as a comparison to actual amounts.

value.original: The Accounting Tab defines the Accounting parameters to be used for inventory in that Warehouse.
The Accounting Tab defines the defaults to use when generating accounting transactions for orders and invoices which contain this product.
The Accounting Tab is used to define the Asset Account to use when a project is completed and the associated asset realized.
The Customer Accounting Tab defines the default accounts to use when this business partner is referenced on an accounts receivable transaction.
The Vendor Accounting Tab defines the default accounts to use when this business partner is referenced in an accounts payable transaction.
The Employee Accounting Tab defines the default accounts to use when this business partner is referenced on a expense reimbursement.
The Cities Tab defines Cities within a Country or Region.
ATTENTION: ANY CHANGES here will effect the structure of your chart of accounts and ARE IRREVERSIBLE! You may loose data for ever. For changes to become effective, you must re-login
Define the elements of your Account Key

The Account Schema Element Tab defines the elements that comprise the account key. A name is defined which will display in documents. Also the order of the elements and if they are balanced and mandatory are indicated.

row.value: The Account Schema Element Tab defines the elements that comprise the account key. A name is defined which will display in documents. Also the order of the elements and if they are balanced and mandatory are indicated.

value.original: The Business Partner Tab defines any Entity with whom an organization transacts.
The Contact Tab defines the contact(s) for a business partner. These contacts are then referenced in documents.
The Location Tab defines the physical location of a business partner. A business partner may have multiple location records.
The Customer Tab defines a Business Partner who is a customer of this organization. If the Customer check box is selected then the necessary fields will display.
The Vendor Tab defines a Business Partner that is a Vendor for this Organization. If the Vendor check box is selected the necessary fields will display.
The Employee Tab defines a Business Partner who is an Employee of this organization. If the Employee is also a Sales Representative then the check box should be selected.
The Define Bank Account Tab defines the banking information for this business partner. This data is used for processing payments and remittances.
The Bank Tab defines a bank that is used by an organization or business partner. Each Bank is given an identifying Name, Address, Routing No and Swift Code
The Account Tab is used to define one or more accounts for a Bank. Each account has a unique Account No and Currency.
The Withholding Tab defines any withholding information for this business partner.

row.value: The Withholding Tab defines any withholding information for this business partner.

value.original: The Translation Tab defines a Document Type in an alternate language.
The Dunning Tab defines the parameters for a dunning level.
The Translation Tab defines the translation to an alternate language

row.value: The Translation Tab defines the translation to an alternate language

value.original: The Order Tax Tab displays the tax amount for an Order based on the lines entered.
The Charge Tab defines the unique charges that may be associated with a document.

Price lists are automatically created based on Product Purchasing Information and the Vendor Category Discount. The other alternative is to copy them from existing pricelists and the re-calculate them. You can also re-calculate the pricelist by referencing no pricelist or referencing the same pricelist.
The Purchasing Tab define the pricing and rules ( pack quantity, UPC, minimum order quantity) for each product.
The Withholding Rules Tab define the rules governing the withholding of amounts.

row.value: The Withholding Rules Tab define the rules governing the withholding of amounts.

value.original: The Tree Tab defines a Tree which will be displayed.
The Report and Process Tab defines each report and process run in the system.
The Report Parameter Tab defines any parameters requried to execute a report or process.
The Defaults Tab displays the Default accounts for an Accounting Schema. These values will display when a new document is opened. The user can override these defaults within the document.

row.value: The Defaults Tab displays the Default accounts for an Accounting Schema. These values will display when a new document is opened. The user can override these defaults within the document.

value.original: The Inventory Count Tab defines the parameters for a manual count and adjustment of inventory

row.value: The Inventory Count Tab defines the parameters for a manual count and adjustment of inventory

value.original: The Inventory Count Line defines the counts of the individual products in inventory.

row.value: The Inventory Count Line defines the counts of the individual products in inventory.

value.original: The Shipments Tab allows you to generate, maintain, enter and process Shipments to a Customer or Returns from a Customer.
The Shipment Line Tab defines the individual items in a Shipment.
The Move Tab defines and identifies the movement of an item or items in inventory.
The Move Line Tab defines the product and quantity to be moved and the location it is moving from and to.
The Invoice Tab defines the parameters of an Invoice generated for a Business Partner. It constitutes an accounts receivable.
The Dunning Level Tab defines the timing and frequency of the dunning notices.
The Invoice Line Tab defines the individual items or charges on an Invoice.
The Invoice Tax Tab displays the total tax due based on the Invoice Lines.
The Revenue Recognition Tab defines the intervals at which revenue will be recognized. You can also base the revenue recognition on provided Service Levels.

row.value: The Revenue Recognition Tab defines the intervals at which revenue will be recognized. You can also base the revenue recognition on provided Service Levels.

value.original: The Vendor Tab displays the Vendors. A Vendor is selected and all products for that Vendor will be displayed.
The Product Details Tab allows you to display and maintain all products for a selected Vendor.
The Greeting Tab defines the manner in which you will address business partners on documents.
The Define Report View defines the views used in report generation
The Transaction Tab displays the transactions that have been processed for this product.
The Invoice Tab defines the parameters of an Invoice generated by a Business Partner. It constitutes an accounts payable.
The Invoice Line Tab defines the individual items or charges on an Invoice.
The Invoice Tax Tab displays the total tax due based on the Invoice Lines.
The Order Line Tab defines the individual items in an order.
The Order Header Tab defines the parameters of an order. The field values defined will determine how the Order Lines are processed.
The Order Tax Tab displays the tax associated with the Order Lines.
The Shipments Tab allows you to generate, maintain, enter and process Shipments from a Vendor or Returns to a Vendor.
The Shipment Line Tab defines the individual items in a Shipment.
The Forms Tab defines any window which is not automatically generated. For System Admin use only.
The Window Access Tab defines the Windows and type of access that this Role is granted.
The Process Access Tab defines the Processes and type of access that this Role is granted.
The Form Access Tab defines the Forms and type of access that this Role is granted.
The Workflow Access Tab defines the Workflows and type of access that this Role is granted.
The Report Access Tab determines who can access a report or process
The Forms Access Tab defines the access rules for this form
The Task Access Tab defines the Roles that will have access to this task and the type of access each Role is granted.
The Window Access Tab defines the Roles which have access to this Window.
The Workflow Access Tab defines the Roles who have access to this Workflow.
The Task Access Tab defines the Task and type of access that this Role is granted.
The Error Message Tab displays error messages that have been generated. They can be deleted with an automated clean up process.

Define the individual field based on the table definition. Please note that you have to make sure that a Costant has the correct SQL datatype (i.e. if it is a 'string', you need to enclose it like 'this').

Product mapping (for details see documentation): 

H_Item => Value
H_ItemDesc => Name / Description
H_ItemDefn => Help
H_ItemType => ProductCategory
H_PartnrID => Value of Business Partner
H_Commodity1 => Vendor Product No
H_Commodity2 => SKU
H_ItemClass => Classification (A,B,C..)
V_OperAmt_T_Cur => Currency
V_OperAmt_T => Price

row.value:
Define the individual field based on the table definition. Please note that you have to make sure that a Costant has the correct SQL datatype (i.e. if it is a 'string', you need to enclose it like 'this').

Product mapping (for details see documentation): 

H_Item => Value
H_ItemDesc => Name / Description
H_ItemDefn => Help
H_ItemType => ProductCategory
H_PartnrID => Value of Business Partner
H_Commodity1 => Vendor Product No
H_Commodity2 => SKU
H_ItemClass => Classification (A,B,C..)
V_OperAmt_T_Cur => Currency
V_OperAmt_T => Price

value.original:
The Bill of Materials tab defines those products that are generated from other products. A Bill of Material (BOM) is one or more Products or BOMs.
Available Quantity: - Stored BOMs have to be created via "Production" - The available quantity of a non-stored BOMs is dynamically calculated - The attribute "Stored" is defined in the "Product" tab
Price: - BOMs must be listed in Pricelists - If the price is 0.00, the price is dynamically calculated
Printing: - Usually, only the BOM information is printed - For invoices, delivery slips and pick lists, you have the option to print the details - In the details, the quantity is listed - and the price, if this is dynamically calculated

row.value:
The Bill of Materials tab defines those products that are generated from other products. A Bill of Material (BOM) is one or more Products or BOMs.

Available Quantity:
- Stored BOMs have to be created via "Production"
- The available quantity of a non-stored BOMs is dynamically calculated
- The attribute "Stored" is defined in the "Product" tab

Price:
- BOMs must be listed in Pricelists
- If the price is 0.00, the price is dynamically calculated

Printing:
- Usually, only the BOM information is printed
- For invoices, delivery slips and pick lists, you have the option to print the details
- In the details, the quantity is listed - and the price, if this is dynamically calculated

value.original: The Production Header Tab defines a unique production plan
The Production Plan Tab defines the items used and generated in a production.
The Production Line Tab displays the actual movements in and out of inventory generated by a Production Plan.
Business Partner Groups for Reporting Accounting Defaults
The Business Partner Group Tab allow for the association of business partners for reporting and accounting defaults.
The Accounting Tab defines the default accounts for any business partner that references this group. These default values can be modified for each business partner if required.
The Accounting Tab defines default accounting parameters. Any product that uses a product category can inherit its default accounting parameters.
The Notice Tab provides a method of viewing messages that are generated by this system when performing processes.
The Electronic Payments Tab is used to define the parameters for the processing of electronic payments.
The Accounting Tab is used to define the accounts used for transactions with this Bank.
The Bank Statement Tab defines the Bank Statement to be reconciled.

row.value: The Bank Statement Tab defines the Bank Statement to be reconciled.

value.original: The Statement Line Tab defines the individual line items on the Bank Statement. They can be entered manually or generated from payments entered.

row.value: The Statement Line Tab defines the individual line items on the Bank Statement. They can be entered manually or generated from payments entered.

value.original:
The Payment Tab defines a payment made by a Business Partner. If it is for a single invoice it can be allocated directly to that invoice using this screen. You can also apply over/under payments:
You have an over-payment, if you received more money than due for a single invoice. Instead of writing the difference off (i.e. would be a gain), you can leave the amount unallocated and use it for later invoices or credit memos. Please note that the Amount is the payment amount, so you need to enter the over-payment as a negative amount.
You can also receive a parcial payment (under-payment). If you decide not to write off the remaining invoice amount, enter the under-payment as a postive amount.

row.value:
The Payment Tab defines a payment made by a Business Partner. If it is for a single invoice it can be allocated directly to that invoice using this screen. You can also apply over/under payments:
You have an over-payment, if you received more money than due for a single invoice. Instead of writing the difference off (i.e. would be a gain), you can leave the amount unallocated and use it for later invoices or credit memos. Please note that the Amount is the payment amount, so you need to enter the over-payment as a negative amount.
You can also receive a parcial payment (under-payment). If you decide not to write off the remaining invoice amount, enter the under-payment as a postive amount.

value.original: The Accounting Tab defines the accounting parameters used for transactions including a charge or charges.
The Organization Accounting Tab defines the default accounting paramters to be used by this Organization.
The Accounting Tab defines the accounting parameters to be used for transactions referencing this Tax Rate.
The Withholding Accounting Tab defines the accounting parameters for Withholding.

row.value: The Withholding Accounting Tab defines the accounting parameters for Withholding.

value.original: The Custom Attribute Tab defines additional attributes or information for a product or entity.

row.value: The Custom Attribute Tab defines additional attributes or information for a product or entity.

value.original: The Cashbook Tab defines a unique cashbook for an organization.

row.value: The Cashbook Tab defines a unique cashbook for an organization.

value.original: The Cashbook Accounting Tab defines the accounting parameters for transaction involving a cashbook.

row.value: The Cashbook Accounting Tab defines the accounting parameters for transaction involving a cashbook.

value.original: The Cash Journal Tab defines the parameters for this journal.
The Cash Line Tab defines the individual lines for this journal.
The Web Request Tab defines any request generated from the Web
System Admin use only. Field Groups allow for grouping of fields within a window
The Request Tab defines any Request submitted by a Business Partner.
The Request Processor Tab allows you to define processes that you want to occur and the frequency and timing of these processes. If no other user is found, the items are assigned to the supervisor.

row.value: The Request Processor Tab allows you to define processes that you want to occur and the frequency and timing of these processes. If no other user is found, the items are assigned to the supervisor.

value.original: The Action History Tab displays any actions which have been taken for a Request.
The Reverse Allocation Tab defines the Payment Allocation to be reversed.

Add the clients this role has access to. The preferred way is that a role is only for one client. If a user should have access to multiple clients, give the user the access to the roles required. Technically, you currently can give a role access to more than one client. This might be discontinued without notice.
Add the organizations the user has access to. Only add organizations of the client of this role.
The Payment Selection Tab defines the bank account and date of the payments to be made. You also create the payments here.
The Payment Selection Line Tab defines the indvidual invoices an organization is paying to a Vendor with this payment.
The Report View Column Tab defines any columns which will be overidded in the generation of the select SQL
Define when to pay a commission to whom. For each period, you start the calculation of the commission after the transcation for that period are completed or cloased.

Define the selection criteria for paying the commission. If you do not enter restricting parameters (e.g. for specific Business Partner (Groups) or Product (Categories), etc. all transactions for the period will be used to calculate the commission.
After converting from the transaction to the commission currency, the formula for calculating the commission is:
(Converted Amount - Subtract Amount) * Amount Multiplier + (Actual Quantity - Subtract Quantity) * Quantity Multiplier
You can choose, that only positive amounts (Converted Amount - Subtract Amount) and positive quantities (Actual Quantity - Subtract Quantity) are used in the calculation.

row.value:
Define the selection criteria for paying the commission. If you do not enter restricting parameters (e.g. for specific Business Partner (Groups) or Product (Categories), etc. all transactions for the period will be used to calculate the commission.

After converting from the transaction to the commission currency,
the formula for calculating the commission is:

(Converted Amount - Subtract Amount) * Amount Multiplier
+ (Actual Quantity - Subtract Quantity) * Quantity Multiplier

You can choose, that only positive amounts (Converted Amount - Subtract Amount) and positive quantities (Actual Quantity - Subtract Quantity) are used in the calculation.

value.original: Define the currency that projects Project are reported. The projects themselves could be in a different currency.
The Cycle Steps determine the logical sequence of events withing your cycle.
Defines the different Project Status to be used in a Project Cycle
Defines the different Project Status to be used in a Project Cycle
The Project Lines Tab is used to define the lines (products and/or services) associated with this Project.
Commission run for a period defined in the Commission window.

For each commission line, a line is generated. You can overwrite the amount and quantity to modify the commission amount, but the suggested way is creating additional Commission Detail lines. Please be aware that manual changes will not reconcile with the Commission Details.

row.value: For each commission line, a line is generated. You can overwrite the amount and quantity to modify the commission amount, but the suggested way is creating additional Commission Detail lines. Please be aware that manual changes will not reconcile with the Commission Details.

value.original: The Used in Column Tab defines the table and column this element resides in.

You may alter the amount and quantity of the detail records, but the suggested way is to add new correcting lines. The amounts are converted from the transaction currency to the Commission Currency (defined in the Commission window) using the start date and the spot exchange rate.

row.value: You may alter the amount and quantity of the detail records, but the suggested way is to add new correcting lines.\nThe amounts are converted from the transaction currency to the Commission Currency (defined in the Commission window) using the start date and the spot exchange rate.

value.original: The Performance Color Tab allows you to alter the system default colors to indicate a performance level.
The Performance Goal Tab defines specific goals for performance.

The Performance Measure Calculation defines how performance measures will be calculated. Please test the statement in SQL*Plus first. The select statement needs to return a single value! Any restrictions for Date range, Organizations, Business Partners, Products should be done via the "Performance Measure" window. This is the generic calculation. As this tends to be somewhat technical, the system has a few examples predefined.

row.value:
The Performance Measure Calculation defines how performance measures will be calculated. Please test the statement in SQL*Plus first.
The select statement needs to return a single value!
Any restrictions for Date range, Organizations, Business Partners, Products should be done via the "Performance Measure" window. This is the generic calculation.
As this tends to be somewhat technical, the system has a few examples predefined.

value.original: The Performance Achievement Tab defines the Tasks to be achieved. The performance is measured by the percentage of reached achievements.
The Performance Measure Tab defines the date range and method to be used for measuring performance.
Column Sets are the combination of Columns to de bincluded in a Financial Report
A column represents a column in a Financial Report
Maintain Segment Values of Report Line Source

The Revenue Recognition plan is generated then invoicing a product with revenue recognition. With Revenue Recognition, the amount is posted to the Unrecognized revenue and over time or based on Service Level booked to Earned Revenue.

row.value: The Revenue Recognition plan is generated then invoicing a product with revenue recognition. With Revenue Recognition, the amount is posted to the Unrecognized revenue and over time or based on Service Level booked to Earned Revenue.

value.original: The service level is automatically created when creating an invoice with products using revenue recognition based on service levels.
Add new service level lines to change the recognized amount
The selection determines what Print Format is used to print a particular Form for your Oranization.
In this tab, you define the documents used for this bank account. You define your check and other payment document (sequence) number as well as format.
System color for backgrounds and indicators
Desktop is a collection of Workbenches

row.value: Desktop is a collection of Workbenches

value.original: Desktop is a collection of Workbenches

row.value: Desktop is a collection of Workbenches

value.original: Workbenches are a collection of Windows
Define the sequence of keywords and to whom the web and mail requets should be routed to.

row.value: Define the sequence of keywords and to whom the web and mail requets should be routed to.

value.original: The Request Tab defines any Request submitted by a Business Partner.
The Action History Tab displays any actions which have been taken for a Request.
Trade discount schema calculates the trade discount percentage

Pricelists are created based on Product Purchase and Category Discounts. The parameters listed here allow to copy and calculate pricelists.
The calculation:
  • Copy and convert price from referenced price list
  • result plus Surcharge Amount
  • result minus Discount
  • if resulting price is less than the original limit price plus min Margin, use this price (only if Margin is not zero)
  • if resulting price is more than the original limit price plus max Margin, use this price (only if Margin us not zero)
  • Round resulting price
The Formula is
NewPrice = (Convert(BasePrice) + Surcharge) * (100-Discount) / 100;
if MinMargin <> 0 then NewPrice = Max (NewPrice, Convert(OrigLimitPrice) + MinMargin);
if MaxMargin <> 0 then NewPrice = Min (NewPrice, Convert(OrigLimitPrice) + MaxMargin);

Example: (assuming same currency)
Original Prices: List=300, Standard=250, Limit=200;
New List Price: Base=List, Surcharge=0, Discount=0, Round

row.value:
Pricelists are created based on Product Purchase and Category Discounts. The parameters listed here allow to copy and calculate pricelists.
The calculation:
  • Copy and convert price from referenced price list
  • result plus Surcharge Amount
  • result minus Discount
  • if resulting price is less than the original limit price plus min Margin, use this price (only if Margin is not zero)
  • if resulting price is more than the original limit price plus max Margin, use this price (only if Margin us not zero)
  • Round resulting price
The Formula is
NewPrice = (Convert(BasePrice) + Surcharge) * (100-Discount) / 100;
if MinMargin <> 0 then NewPrice = Max (NewPrice, Convert(OrigLimitPrice) + MinMargin);
if MaxMargin <> 0 then NewPrice = Min (NewPrice, Convert(OrigLimitPrice) + MaxMargin);

Example: (assuming same currency)
Original Prices: List=300, Standard=250, Limit=200;
New List Price: Base=List, Surcharge=0,

value.original: Dates, when rhe resource is not available (e.g. vacation)
The product for the resource is automatically created and synchronized. Update Name, Unit of Measure, etc. in the Resource and don't change it in the product.
Maintain Resoce types and their principal availability.
The Accounting Tab defines the defaults to use when generating accounting transactions for orders and invoices which contain this Expense Type. Not all accounts apply.
The Pricing Tab displays the List, Standard and Limit prices for each price list a product is contained in.
The Pricing Tab displays the List, Standard and Limit prices for each price list a resource is contained in.
The Accounting Tab defines the defaults to use when generating accounting transactions for orders and invoices which contain this resource. Not all accounts apply to resources.
The print format determines how data is rendered for print.
Item in the print format maintaining layout information

Printer Paper Size, Orientation and Margins. The Validation Code contains the MediaSize name. The names of the media sizes correspond to those in the IPP 1.1 RFC 2911 - http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2911.txt
Display Order of the Print Format Items
Sort Order of the Print Format Items
Sequence if the Fields in a Tab
Time and Expense Report Line (not invoiced)
View and modify Time and Expense Report Lines.

The Print Table Format lets you define how table header, etc. is printed. If you leave the entries empty, the default colors and fonts are used:
Fonts are based on the Font used in the Report; Page Header and Table Header will be bold, the Function Font is Bold-Italic, the Footer Font is two points smaller, the Parameter Font is Italic.
